info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Southampton , the City of Franklin and the southwestern City of Suffolk through 330 PM EDT... At 245 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Courtland to 10 miles northwest of Newsoms to near Claresville. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Courtland, Boykins, Suffolk, Newsoms, Hunterdale, Capron, Branchville, Handsom, Worrell, Sunbeam, Sebrell, Drewryville, Shiloh and Story. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
